org.dgfoundation.amp.utils

Class AmpCollectionUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.dgfoundation.amp.utils.AmpCollectionUtils

  • public class AmpCollectionUtils
extends java.lang.Object
    Utility class for collections. will add other methods soon.

        Creates Map object from Collection. Uses HashMap implementation of Map
        Type Parameters:
        K - type of the key of elements..
        E - type of element in collection and map
        Parameters:
        col - collection of E's
        resolver - interface implementation which 'knows' how to resolve key from element
        Returns:
        Map object where keys are of type K and values are E

      • joinInNew

        public static <E,K> java.util.Collection<E> joinInNew(java.util.Collection<E> sesCol,
                                                      java.util.Collection<E> dbCol,
                                                      AmpCollectionUtils.KeyResolver<K,E> keyResolver)
        Return new collection based on comparing elements in two other collections. sesCol is used to iterate all elements and dbCol to check for IDs in. If same ID exists in both, dbCol element will go in result collection. If ID is only in dbCol then it will NOT go in result collection. If ID is only in sesCol then it will go in result collection. Please note that this method returns new collection object and if used with Hibernate in some cases may result in error which says that collection cannot be dereferenced.
        Type Parameters:
        E - Element type
        K - Element ID type.
        Parameters:
        sesCol - main collection to iterate for elements. Usually this is one from session or form.
        dbCol - collection which is used as reference to compare changes. usually this one is old state in db.
        keyResolver - class which implements AmpCollectionUtils.KeyResolver and knows how to resolve ID property of type K from E.
        Returns:

      • join

        public static <E,K> java.util.Collection<E> join(java.util.Collection<E> mainCol,
                                                 java.util.Collection<E> refCol,
                                                 AmpCollectionUtils.KeyResolver<K,E> keyResolver)
        Joins two collection using rules of synchronization of session and db collections. Result is same mainCol object but updated according refCol with following rules : if E is in both collection then it is moved from refCol to resulting mainCol. if E is only in mainCol then it is removed from it - from result. if E is only in refCol then it is added to resulting mainCol. E is element specified (and compared) by K type property which usually is ID of entity bean.
        Type Parameters:
        E - type of elements in collections
        K - type of PK of entity bean or type of some property that is used to compare elements.
        Parameters:
        mainCol - collection that would be updated according to refCol. usually this is collection of db.
        refCol - collection of reference. usually this is new state from ActionForm or session.
        keyResolver -
        Returns:

      • joinAndMarkRemoved

        public static <E,K> java.util.Collection<E> joinAndMarkRemoved(java.util.Collection<E> mainCol,
                                                               java.util.Collection<E> refCol,
                                                               AmpCollectionUtils.KeyWorker<K,E> keyWorker)
        Joins two collections in mainCol marking elements that exists only in mainCol for removal. How to mark elements is defined by AmpCollectionUtils.KeyWorker interface implementation. Usually id values are set to same but negative, this let us know which should be deleted or updated or inserted.
        Type Parameters:
        E -
        K -
        Parameters:
        mainCol -
        refCol -
        keyWorker -
        Returns:

                                                  AmpCollectionUtils.KeyWorker<K,E> keyWorker)

      • createTree

        public static <E,N,K> java.util.List<N> createTree(java.util.List<E> source,
                                                   AmpCollectionUtils.NodeWorker<K,E,N> worker)
        Create tree from flat list using parent ID's of elements in the list. Each element in source list may have parent ID. These IDs are used to build hierarchy (tree) from source. If elements do not have parent id (NULL value for parent id) then they are considered as top level nodes in resulting tree. How to retrieve parent ID, children, and how to set parents are "known" to NodeWorker implementation passed as parameter to the method. So method gets list of E, worker of K,E and N. Result is list of N. Each E in source list will have corresponding N in resulting tree, and their IDs will be same. It may be useful to make N subclass of E or N to have field of E type. But it is also possible E and N to be same type or completely different.
        Type Parameters:
        E - type of element in source (flat) list.
        N - type of nodes in tree.
        K - type of node and element IDs, usually Long.
        Parameters:
        source - list from which we want to build tree.
        worker - NodeWorker implementation which "knows" some details about elements in list and nodes in tree.
        Returns:
        list of top level nodes. Each node will contain children if they have.

      • sortTree

        public static <K,E,N> void sortTree(java.util.List<N> tree,
                                    AmpCollectionUtils.NodeWorker<K,E,N> worker,
                                    java.util.Comparator<N> comparator)
        Sorts tree nodes. Sorts each level separately using provided comparator. K and E types come from worker and are not used in this sorting method BUT NOTE that comparator and list should be same type and should match node type N in worker. Example: List tree = ... Comparator comparator = ... NodeWorker worker = ... sortTree(tree, worker, comparator);
        Type Parameters:
        K - Type of node ID. Not used.
        E - Type of Elements in flat list. Not Used.
        N - Type of nodes in tree and in comparator. This one is used and list and comparator should be of this type.
        Parameters:
        tree - list of top level nodes in tree. Node type is N and is built by createTree(List, NodeWorker) method.
        worker - same worker class that was used to build tree.
        comparator - node comparator. It should be of type N - node type.
